shared_text:
Union County Sheriff's Office, Monroe, NC
August 15 at 11:53 PM ·

Deputy Killed in Off Duty Motorcycle Accident

With heavy hearts and extreme sadness, Sheriff Eddie Cathey announces the tragic death of Deputy Sheriff Christopher Scott Horne, age 50. Chris was killed in an off duty motorcycle accident that occurred shortly before 6 pm today. The accident occurred in the 4600 block of Griffith Road after colliding with another vehicle.

The NC State Highway Patrol is investigating the cause of the accident.

Deputy Sheriff Horne was a valued member of the Sheriff’s Office SAFE (Sheriff’s Alcohol Field Enforcement) Unit. He served with the agency for over 7 years but also previously served with the Monroe Police Department, Waxhaw PD as well as the Stallings PD. He will be greatly missed.

NC Emergency Management
July 31 at 10:48 PM ·

Evening update on Hurricane #Isaias:
• The most recent forecast shifts Hurricane Isaias slightly westward and further inland over NC Monday into Tuesday. Watches will likely be issued for the region Saturday as Hurricane Isaias nears NC.
• The most likely arrival time of tropical storm force wind speeds is Monday afternoon for southeastern NC.
• Scattered showers and storms will continue across the state through the weekend. Rainfall from Isaias will increase in coverage late Sunday night and through the day Monday. Isaias will generally bring 2-4” of rain, with locally higher amounts of up to 6” possible across eastern NC. While significant rainfall is not expected, minor flooding is possible in low lying and poorly drained areas or in regions where localized heavy rain falls in a short period of time.
• Storm surge remains possible along the coast and sounds/rivers, but inundations amounts are unknown at this time.
• Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf are likely along the coast of NC this weekend and into next week.

Rendering of new UCSO Administration Building

We are excited to share this video of the new Union County Sheriff’s Office targeted to break ground in October 2020. Everyone involved in the design phase has worked diligently to remain fiscally responsible while identifying critical functions necessary to ensure Union County will continue to achieve long term success in keeping our citizens and community safe. We are grateful to the citizens of Union County who voted in support of the Public Safety bond in November 2018 to make this possible.

Everyone involved in the design phase has worked diligently to remain fiscally responsible while identifying critical functions necessary to ensure Union County will continue to achieve long term success in keeping our citizens and community safe. We are grateful to the citizens of Union County who voted in support of the Public Safety bond in November 2018 to make this possible.

NC Department of Health and Human Services
June 4 at 6:48 PM ·

NCDHHS is launching new initiatives to expand #COVID19 testing and contact tracing. Testing and tracing are key components of NC’s strategy to responsibly ease restrictions, while continuing to slow the spread of the virus.

New online tools include:
🌡️ Check My Symptoms (www.ncdhhs.gov/symptoms) allows people to enter their symptoms to determine if they should consider getting tested.
🔎 Find My Testing Place (www.ncdhhs.gov/TestingPlace) allows people to enter their county or ZIP code and access a list of nearby testing site locations online.

NCDHHS also launched the COVID-19 Community Team Outreach (CCTO) Tool, a password-protected online software that helps people track their symptoms if they have been advised to do so by the COVID-19 Community Team. The tool also helps streamline and integrate contact tracing work across the state.

👉 Learn more: https://www.ncdhhs.gov/news/press-releases/ncdhhs-launches-testing-and-contact-tracing-resources-help-slow-spread-covid-19

UC HEROES: During this uncertain time, it's important to recognize individuals in Union County going above and beyond to help our community.

Don Moye takes pride in serving as Union County's Emergency Management Director. Don has led the Emergency Operation Center through multiple emergency situations since starting with Union County in 2012. Through hurricanes, severe storms, major events, dignitary visits, and now a public health crisis, Don has helped coordinate the County's response among numerous departments, agencies, municipalities, and organizations. Don is steady in the face of an emergency and works hard to ensure Union County residents are safe and informed. Don's lifelong dedication to public service is so very appreciated. After decades working in law enforcement and emergency management, Don is retiring this year and looks forward to spending more time with his family.

We know there are so many UC Heroes, so please share your UC Hero in the comments or nominate one here: tinyurl.com/ucheroes

post_text: A new Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) program will help NC families purchase food for children impacted by COVID-19 school closings. See this post from the NC Department of Health and Human Services for more information.
shared_text:
NC Department of Health and Human Services
April 20 at 6:42 PM ·

A new Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) program will help NC families purchase food for children impacted by #COVID19NC school closings. What to know:
- Families whose children are eligible for free and reduced lunch at school will receive $250 in P-EBT benefits per child, with the possibility of additional benefits if schools are closed beyond 5/15.
- Families do NOT need to apply
- Current Food and Nutrition Services (FNS) recipients will receive this benefit on their EBT card
- P-EBT families not enrolled in FNS will be mailed a new EBT card
- Benefits will roll out soon
https://www.ncdhhs.gov/news/press-releases/ncdhhs-provide-additional-food-benefits-more-800000-children-impacted-covid-19

April is Child Abuse Prevention Month. In an effort to bring awareness to the cause, Union County Division of Social Services employees planted pinwheels around the trees at the entrances to the Human Services building.

In 2019 DSS received 2,184 reports of child abuse and/or neglect. Of those, 1,616 were accepted for investigation.

In 2008, Prevent Child Abuse America introduced the pinwheel as the new national symbol for child abuse prevention through Pinwheels for Prevention®. What our research showed, and what our experiences since then have proven, is that people respond to the pinwheel. By its very nature, the pinwheel connotes whimsy and childlike notions. In essence, it has come to serve as the physical embodiment, or reminder, of the great childhoods we want for all children.

In 2008, Prevent Child Abuse America introduced the pinwheel as the new national symbol for child abuse prevention through Pinwheels for Prevention®. What our research showed, and what our experiences since then have proven, is that people respond to the pinwheel. By its very nature, the pinwheel connotes whimsy and childlike notions. In essence, it has come to serve as the physical embodiment, or reminder, of the great childhoods we want for all children.
